dismissalText.long: c Raqibul Hasan b Alok Kapali
dismissalText.commentary: Salman Butt c Raqibul Hasan b Alok Kapali 70 (84b 10x4 0x6 107m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: Salman holes out to long-on. The innings was moving along in singles in the recent overs and he decides to up the ante but perishes in the process. It was tossed up outside off stump and Salman swung it on a bent knee to long-on.

dismissalText.long: c Abdur Razzak b Alok Kapali
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Yousuf c Abdur Razzak b Alok Kapali 59 (56b 7x4 0x6 74m) SR: 105.35

dismissalComment.html: Kapali is the man of the moment. Another wicket. Big one too. Yousuf is gone. Flighted loopy delivery, turning away from Yousuf who tried to drive inside-out but hit it straight to covers. The ball dipped on him and he couldn't keep it down or get under it well enough to clear the fielder.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And in the middle, Malik has been cleaned up. He was struggling out there, unable to find his timing and has finally perished. He moved outside leg stump and tried to drive inside-out a full delivery but missed it completely.

headshotImage.longCaption: Sohail Tanvir player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: The wickets are falling a heap now. Change of pace. It was slower through the air and Tanvir dragged it straight to midwicket

headshotImage.longCaption: Wahab Riaz headshot

dismissalComment.html: Dead plumb and Pakistan have been bowled out for 233. Arm ball - full and straight, the front leg was planted across and he couldn't get his bat around in time.

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Dolar Mahmud
dismissalText.commentary: Kamran Akmal c Mushfiqur Rahim b Dolar Mahmud 25 (27b 2x4 1x6 54m) SR: 92.59

dismissalComment.html: Sharp acrobatic catch from Rahim, the keeper. It was full, outside off stump and Akmal, rooted to the crease, drove hard and got a thick outside edge. The ball was traveling really fast to right of Rahim who dived to pluck it safely.

dismissalText.long: run out (Raqibul Hasan/Abdur Razzak)
dismissalText.commentary: Younis Khan run out (Raqibul Hasan/Abdur Razzak) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Younis is run out. It spun in towards middle stump, worked to right of midwicket where Raqibul Hussai moved quickly, dived to his right to make the stop and threw at the stumps at the non-striker's ends. Razzak collected the ball in front of the stumps and broke the stumps quickly. Gone! Two in two balls. Bangladesh are getting back in to the game courtesy some fab fielding. First Rahim and now Raqibul.

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Misbah-ul-Haq lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 39 (22b 3x4 2x6 28m) SR: 177.27

dismissalComment.html: Misbah is done in by a good off cutter from Mortaza. The ball cut in from outside off, the bat came down outside the line and caught him in front. There was some noise as the ball passed the bat, Misbah suggests it might have been inside-edge but he is gone

dismissalText.long: c Kamran Akmal b Shahid Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Kamran Akmal b Shahid Afridi 29 (38b 4x4 0x6 60m) SR: 76.31

dismissalComment.html: Afridi loops it in the air and entices Tamim into playing the drive. Tamim is beaten by the spin and his back leg is in the air,  Akmal whips the bails off in a flash. Stumped or is it caught? The official scorers say it's a catch which means he probably got a nick to it as well. Now Afridi has 18 wickets for this calendar year

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Afridi cleans him up with a quickish topspinner. It slid on straight and quick on the off stump line, a surprised Kapali tries to jam the bat down in a hurry but can only edge it back to his stumps. Afridi continues to impress with his variations. His bowling has got better and better these days

headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: short of length, outside off, straightening a touch and a bit of bounce, Raqibul doesn't get close to the line and has a flash away from the body and it flew off the bat to Younis at a wide third slip position where he plucks a head-high catch to his left
Bowled him! From round the stumps, it landed on a length outside off stump and cut in to beat the hurried prod and crashes into the leg stump.

commentTextItems.html: leans forward to defend and that's it Pakistan have earned a convincing win over the hosts

commentPostTextItems.html: On a sluggish track, the Bangladesh chase never got going after the openers fell. It was a strange little innings from Ashraful who couldn't get going at all. He did end up with an unbeaten half-century but he couldn't get any momentum.
Ashraful: "They batted really well. If we had restricted them to 190 we would have had a good chance. We gave away 40 runs more. We need one of our openers to carry on after the start they got."
Malik: "Salman and Yousuf bhai played really well and in the end Misbah batted well too. The credit goes to the guys ; we want to be consistent."
That's it from us. Thanks for logging on. Join us day after tomorrow for the India-Pakistan encounter.

dismissalComment.html: Younis is run out. It spun in towards middle stump, worked to right of midwicket where Raqibul Hussai moved quickly, dived to his right to make the stop and threw at the stumps at the non-striker's ends. Razzak collected the ball in front of the stumps and broke the stumps quickly. Gone! Two in two balls. Bangladesh are getting back in to the game courtesy some fab fielding. First Rahim and now Raqibul.

dismissalComment.html: Kapali is the man of the moment. Another wicket. Big one too. Yousuf is gone. recentPreviewStory.credit: George Binoy is a staff writer at Cricinfo
